newsitem.title: FRANCE: ADP export traffic down 0.7 last month.
newsitem.headline: ADP export traffic down 0.7 last month.

text.p: July 1996 export traffic from the Paris airports, Charles de Gaulle and Orly, totalled 53,282 tonnes, a decrease of 0.7 percent on the same month last year, Aeroports de Paris, (ADP) figures show.
Traffic on the ADP's major export route, North America, fell by 3.2 percent to 15,064 tonnes while shipments to the Far East declined by 8.3 percent to 10,766 tonnes.

In contrast, shipments from CDG and Orly to the Middle East rose by 12.5 percent to 5,483 tonnes with exports to sub-Saharan Africa also recording double-digt growth, up rose by 11.4 percent to 4,449 tonnes.
Global export traffic to the ADP in July 1996, by region, with percentage change on July 1995, were as follows:
